thread.title: Girls soccer: Van Voorhis sisters lead undefeated Mariners over Rising Tide
thread.title_full: Girls soccer: Van Voorhis sisters lead undefeated Mariners over Rising Tide

author: Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com
title: Girls soccer: Van Voorhis sisters lead undefeated Mariners over Rising Tide
text: Posted Oct. 6, 2015 at 9:50 PM By Cape Cod Times Posted Oct. 6, 2015 at 9:50 PM » Social News PLYMOUTH - Eliza Van Voorhis scored four goals and assisted a fifth while sister Charlotte notched her fourth shutout of the season in Falmouth Academy's 6-0 win over Rising Tide on Tuesday. Eliza Van Voorhis, Helena Weare and Jane Earley all tallied in the first half, with Eliza added three more goals after the break. Charlotte Van Voorhis and here defensive mates kept the Herons at bay throughout, en route to the shutout. Kendall Currance, Sintra Reves Sohn, Maddy Francis and Nell Boen were all key for the Mariners (5-0-1 overall and Cape & Islands). Sturgis West 5, Cape Cod Academy 0: Chloe Bass’ hat trick led the Navigators past the Seahawks in Osterville. Sophie Nadolny added a goal and an assist, Claire Meli had one goal and Sarah Walman chipped in with two assists for Sturgis West (3-3-2, 3-2-2 C&I). The Navigators led 5-0 at the half. Cape Cod Academy fell to 0-6 overall and 0-4 in the Cape & Islands League. Sturgis East 6, Cape Tech 0: The Storm rebounded from a tough loss on Monday to use a strong team effort victory over the Crusaders at Old Townhouse Field in Yarmouth. Lilly Bergeron led the way with two goals while Jorgia Bergin, Sean Liddy and Emily Boyle added goals en route to a 5-0 lead at the half. Jenna Sweeten capped the scoring for Sturgis East (3-6, 2-4 Cape & Islands) in the second half. Maggie Paul and Sarah Clifford each played a half in net in the shutout for the Storm. Cape Tech is 0-5. Nantucket 3, St. John Paul II 2: The Whalers scored three unanswered goals, including the only tally in the second half, to top the Lions in a Cape & Islands League battle at the Water District fields in Sandwich. Katie Wojciechowski scored off a pass from Danielle Demetriades before the 10-minute mark to put St. John Paul II (3-6, 2-3 C&I) ahead. The Lions doubled that lead eight minutes later when Demetriades scored off a pass from Olivia Bengtson. Nantucket (6-0, 5-0 C&I) battled back to tie the match by halftime, then scored late in the second half to win it. By Cape Cod Times
